docs.lead_paragraph: THE LOUVRE MUSEUM (Learn Technologies Interactive/Voyager; $29.95; Windows 3.1 and later, Mac 7.0 and later.) THE LOUVRE MUSEUM stands among only a handful of collections that can boast of a broad spectrum of art history under one roof. So a CD-ROM that focuses only on what is displayed in the Louvre, a former royal palace, is probably just as good at explaining art history as others that draw on artworks from around the world.

headline.main: Introduction to the Louvre Is Mixed With Fun and Games

docs.abstract: Verne G Kopytoff reviews computer software from Learn Technologies Interactive on Louvre Museum, part of museum series for children; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The state has failed to provide enough money to carry out recommendations about how to reduce teen-age pregnancies and to assist teen-agers who are pregnant or have children, a Rutgers University study released yesterday reported. The study, conducted by the Network for Family Life Education in Rutgers' School of Social Work, said that the state had carried out many of the recommendations made by a state task force in 1988, including increasing funds for community colleges and family planning agencies, and expanding school-based programs dealing with pregnancy. But Ann Shurmann, program manager of Network for Family Life, said in a statement, ''Most of these efforts are so underfunded that they are unable to reach a significant number of young people.''

headline.main: State Criticized on Funds For Pregnancy Programs

docs.abstract: Rutgers University study finds that New Jersey has failed to provide enough money to carry out recommendations about how to reduce teen-age pregnancies and to assist teen-agers who are pregnant or have children (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: No mention was made of the extremely low Caesarean section rate of babies delivered by certified nurse-wives in the Personal Health column of Jan. 12, ''A Saner Approach on Caesarean Issue.'' As my wonderful midwives pointed out, a vast majority of the patients are nurses and doctors, as my husband and I are. I can tell you as a neonatal intensive care nurse that there are other complications of C-sections that land babies in the intensive care unit. Certified nurse-midwives offer emotional support, drug-free births, as well as episiotomies only when necessary. ROSEMARIE TISHELMAN New York
docs.abstract: Rosemarie Tishelman letter on Jan 12 article on Caesarian birth; points out that no mention was made of extremely low Caesarean section rate of babies delivered by certified nurse-midwives

docs.lead_paragraph: The discovery that autistic children appear to have subtle abnormalities in body movements that can be diagnosed as early as 3 months is leading researchers to hope for new treatments. The findings, by Dr. Philip Teitelbaum, a psychologist at the University of Florida in Gainesville, are preliminary. But they have generated intense interest because for the first time, a method is being proposed for diagnosing the condition in babies whose brains are still developing rapidly.

headline.main: Movement May Offer Early Clue to Autism

docs.abstract: Dr Philip Teitelbaum of University of Florida reports that autistic children appear to have subtle abnormalities in body movements that can be diagnosed as early as 3 months; most autism is not diagnosed in children until they are at least 3 years old; a reliable way to diagnose it earlier, when the brain is its most malleable, might enable doctors to devise therapies to alleviate or eliminate the conditions; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: MELINDA DuBOIS has had recurring dreams about Dr. Barnett A. Slepian, the slain mainstay of the abortion clinic she helps run, dreams in which he is very much alive. In one dream, the slight, unassuming doctor had fled to Canada and sent her an indistinct E-mail message. In another, the two are chatting and she says to him, ''How weird it is that you're not here.''

headline.main: Our Towns; After a Doctor's Slaying, a Clinic Struggles

docs.abstract: Joseph Berger (Our Towns) column on Buffalo GYN Womenservices; clinic still manages to provide gynecological and abortion services to its mostly poor and working-class patients despite murder of Dr Barnett A Slepian, death threats posted on the Internet, and daily presence of sidewalk protesters; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN Kathy Collins of Huntington wanted to shed some pounds a few years ago, she headed for the gym. But unlike the women who join plush health clubs and climb onto elaborate exercise machines, Ms. Collins climbed into the ring. A former three-sport athlete in high school, Ms. Collins had ballooned to 240 pounds by age 23 and felt she was out of control. ''I smoked two packs a day,'' she said. ''I drank like a fish and ate like a horse.''

headline.main: With This Ring: Women Fall for Boxing

docs.abstract: Article on growing number of women who are getting involved in professional boxing on Long Island; focuses on success of Kathy Collins, who began her boxing career at Academy of Boxing for Women in Huntington; photo (M)
